validate.py¶

Validators for indata.

Indata can be sent to validate_indata, which will use the corresponding functions to check each field.

validate.validate_creator(data: str) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the creator field.

It must be a non-empty string. If uuid, confirms that uuid is present in db.

Parameters

data (str) – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

validate.validate_datasets(data: list) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the datasets field.

It must be a list of uuids. Validate that the datasets exist in the db.

Parameters

data (str) – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

validate.validate_email(data) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the email field.

It must be a string.

Parameters

data – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

validate.validate_extra(data) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the extra field.

It must be a dict.

Parameters

data – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

validate.validate_field(field_key: str, field_value: Any) → bool[source]¶

Validate that the input data matches expectations.

Will check the data based on the key.

The validation is only done at the technical level, e.g. a check that input is of the correct type.

Checks for e.g. permissions and that the correct fields are provided for the entry must be performed separately.

Parameters

  • field_key (str) – The field to validate.

  • field_value (Any) – The value to validate.

Returns

Whether validation passed.

Return type

bool

validate.validate_links(data: list) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the links field.

It must have the form [{'url': value, 'description': value}, ...].

Parameters

data – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

validate.validate_permissions(data: list) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the permissions field.

It must be a list containing permissions found in PERMISSIONS.

Parameters

data (list) – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

validate.validate_publications(data: list) → bool[source]¶

Validate input for the publications field.

It must have the form [{'title': value, 'doi': value}, ...].

Parameters

data (list) – The data to be validated.

Returns

Validation passed.

Return type

bool

Raises

ValueError – Validation failed.

Validate input for field that must have a str value.

It must be a non-empty string.

Validate input for the user field.

It must be a non-empty string. If uuid, confirms that uuid is present in db.
